like I said though, you just need to partition, and mount your drie?
partition with cfdisk (cfdisk /dev/hdb), format with mkfs.ext3 /dev/hdb1, and then mount it (mount /dev/hdb1 /whereever)
when i type cfdisk /dev/hdb it says "FATAL ERROR: Cannot Open Disk Drive"
are you there? When i type cfdisk /dev/hdb it says "FATAL ERROR: Cannot open disk drive"
you will need to use sudo on all of those commands
also, the /whereever is supposed to be wherever you want to mount the filesystem.
so, for example, you could make a directory under mnt called hdb, and then mount it like "mount /dev/hdb1 /mnt/hdb"
